ALLEGATION:
Approximately a month ago, youth was being restrained by two unknown staff for
being physically aggressive with staff. During that time, Staff 1 member intervened
by grabbing youth by the neck, picking youth up off the bed by her neck, and putting
her on the ground. Youth was observed coughing during that time. Youth may have
been choking. Youth did not have any marks or bruises at the time. Management is
aware of the incident.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received on 05/02/2022 and was investigated jointly with the
DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed at the Program Manager onsite in collaboration with DHHS Specialist
on 05/04/2022. She is not aware of any incident involving staff grabbing, choking,
and putting Youth A on the ground. She reports Youth A has been restraint, but she
has no records of Youth A been choked or physically hurt during the restraints. She
believes the allegations are made up from one of two staff members who are no
longer working at the facility. She reported one Staff 3 was terminated due to
attendance. The Staff 4 resigned and did not work the full two weeks, so she didn’t
get paid and is upset about not getting paid the full two weeks. No staff person had
reported allegations of staff mistreating or performing an inappropriate restraint on
Youth A. She did meet with staff several weeks ago about Youth’s A behavior and
how to not harbor any feelings toward the youth due to her aggressive behavior
towards staff. She reported Youth has not reported any concerns about staff choking
her. There is two restraint involving Staff 1 and Youth A and they were both done on
03/11/2022. She provided copies of the restraint reports.
I interviewed Youth A onsite in collaboration with DHHS Specialist on 05/04/2022.
Youth A is 17 years old, in the 10th grade, and has been at the facility since
December 2021. She reported that she has been restraint a lot but does not know if
any of the restraints were done wrong. She said Staff 1 had restrained her two or
three times and was too aggressive when she restrained her. She remembers Staff
1 restrained her in March of 2022 when she classroom. Youth A said the reason she
was restrained was because she was hitting the computer keyboard, throwing
things, making a lot of noise, and disturbing the class. She said Staff 1 picked her up
3

and slammed her on the floor. Staff 2 was present during the incident in the
classroom. She denied being choked by Staff 1. She was not injured and denied
being examined by the nurse.
I interviewed Staff 1 onsite in collaboration with DHHS Specialist on 05/04/2022.
Staff 1 has been working at the facility for 10 years and recently was promoted to
team supervisor. She reported Youth A is not currently on her unit. Youth A was
moved to another unit because she was having issues with another youth on her
unit. She recalls several weeks ago she and Staff 2 had to restrain Youth A in the
classroom. She reported Youth A was hitting the computer and throwing things, so
Youth A was placed in a standing restraint which she fought and was placed in a
team restraint. She denied Youth A was slammed on the ground or got hurt during
the restraint. She said later that same day, Youth A and was arguing with another
youth and Staff 3, who is no longer employed at the facility, took Youth A’s water
bottle. Youth A went after that staff person and Youth A was placed in a team control
restraint. Staff 1 denied ever grabbing or choking Youth A. She reported Staff 3 and
4 no longer work at the facility, and they both had issues with her. She said Staff 3
complained that she was talking to her during work. Staff 4 had issues with Youth
A’s behavior, so she addressed with her at the Team Meetings. She things that
these two staff persons are upset with her and are retaliating by making up these
allegations.
I interviewed Staff 2 onsite in collaboration with DHHS Specialist on 05/04/2022,
Staff 2 has been working at the facility for 7 years and currently Shift Supervisor.
She reported Youth A is a like a hurricane and goes from 0 to 100 in a less than a
minute. She recalls being involved in two restraints involving Youth A couple months
ago but does not recall the specific reason. She said the staff involved never
slammed or choked Youth A during the restraints. She typically works first shift and
the youths are in school, so she does not do a lot of restraints. She denied
witnessing Staff 1 slam or choke Youth A. She said she and Staff 1 preformed the
team restraint on Youth A. She reported being trained in CPI and no disciplinary
issues.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on 05/19/2022. She
reported Youth A has extensive behavioral issues and is very aggressive. She is
currently on a wait list to placed in a secured facility. She is not aware of any incident
where Youth A was picked up by her neck, choked, or slammed on the floor. She
reported staff are doing their best to keep Youth A safe due to her aggressive
behavior. She expressed no concerns about the facility or staff.
4

The following documents were reviewed:
 Incident report dated 03/11/2022 at 11:00 AM. Youth A was upset after staff
found a straw that had been in her pocket in classroom. She became upset
and disruptive, yelling and cursing at her peers and began to hit the
computer. An attempt was made to redirect Youth A, but she became
aggressive and started to push staff. Youth A was placed in a standing hold,
but she was hitting and pushing staff, so she was placed in a team restraint.
 Incident report dated 03/11/2022 at 3:14 PM. Youth A refused to leave the
restroom, so that her peers could use the restroom. Staff attempted to talk to
Youth A and offered her coping skills, but she did not respond. Youth A
punched and pushed staff, so a protective intervention was performed. Youth
A fought the intervention and was placed in a team restraint.
 The termination letter for Staff 3 noted she failed to show for two scheduled
workdays. She was terminated as of 3/28/2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: Based on the interviews of the staff involved the restraints
technique used by staff were safe and appropriate. Youth A
admitted to being restrained but denied being choked or hurt
during the restraint. One of the staff involved is no longer
employed at the facility.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings in this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status.
